parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.56</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Strings </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Compile expression and makes it final, preventing it from:
* repeated [[compile]] or [[compileFinal]]
* removal by [[nil]]
* remote rewrite using [[publicVariable]], [[publicVariableClient]] and [[publicVariableServer]]
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> This feature is only available in retail version of Arma 3</value></part></template>
 </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value>'''compileFinal''' expression </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> expression: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Code]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>myCode <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> compileFinal "a <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> a + 1"; 
[[call]] myCode;<br> 
<template lineStart="1"><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>//--- Repeated compile won't have any effect</value></part></template>
myCode <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> compileFinal "a <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> a + 2";<br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>//--- Duplicate code will be final as well</value></part></template>
myDuplicateCode = myCode;
</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[compile]], [[call]], [[spawn]], [[isFinal]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 14, 2013
<dt class="note">[[User:AgentRev01|AgentRev]]<dd class="note">
When broadcasting a compileFinal'ed variable using [[publicVariable]] or its variants, the variable also becomes final on the other client(s) and/or the server.

Also, compileFinal does not prevent [[Event_handlers|event handlers]] from being removed or overwritten.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
